result.execSummary:
The defendant Sabri S Sabri was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay a FINE of $1,000.00 PLUS ALL COSTS and SURCHARGES by 10-16-2015 or as a penalty if not paid, the defendant is subject to a civil judgment being issued.

Defendant's motion for expungement is denied by the court.

10-20-15/ Jeffrey Kremers
The Court granted defendant request for a payment plan.
The fine, costs and surcharges shall be paid at the rate of $75 per month starting Dec 1, 2015.
All other conditions imposed shall remain the same.
Consecutive to: to any other sentence.

Received, signed and filed:
Order allowing the defendant to extend the time of paying costs and surcharges in this case.
Court allowed the defendant to pay $75.00 per month starting December 1, 2015.
Order signed and filed.
Copies forwarded to the parties on today's date.
cab
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Jeffrey A. Kremers, Br. 36, for review. mag
DEFENDANT'S REQUEST FOR PAYMENT PLAN.
ADMINISTRATIVE STAY ALLOWING DEFENDANT UNTIL  11/16/2015  TO PAY FINE AND COSTS, GRANTED.

Defendant Sabri S Sabri in court with attorney Mark A. Schoenfeldt.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Sworn in as Arabic Interpreter, Awman Khatib.
The case is calendared for a trial today.  The defendant wants to change his plea.
On state's motion, charge is amended to Disorderly Conduct, Wisconsin statutes 947.01 (1), a Class B Misdemeanor.
As to charge as amended:
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.
The parties wish to proceed to sentencing.
.
Sentencing proceeded....
.
  The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 2 days  in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 2 days time served.  Court ordered defendant to pay a FINE of $1,000.00  PLUS ALL COSTS and SURCHARGES by 10/16/2015 or, as a penalty if not paid, the defendant is subject to a civil judgment being issued.  Defendant is not to possess a firearm.
Defendant's motion for expungement is denied by the court.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant Sabri S Sabri in court with attorney Mark A. Schoenfeldt.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin. FILE NOT IN COURT. Case called at request of the defense. Defense counsel WAIVED interpreter for this hearing only. Case set for Jury Trial on 5/26/2015. Defense counsel unable to appear and requests and adjournment, GRANTED as a defense adjournment. Court VACATED the Jury Trial date of 5/26/2015. Case adjourned for Jury Trial. Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to a branch of the Circuit Court to be determined.  Jury trial scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Arabic Interpreter.

CASE CALLED AT 1:30 PM
Defendant Sabri S Sabri in court with attorney Mark A. Schoenfeldt.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sworn as interpreter: Ayman Khatib. Due to court and attorney calendar, case called at 1:30 pm. Defense requests a Jury Trial date. Court ordered all motions filed and discovery turned over 20 DAYS prior to trial. All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned to branch 23.  Jury trial scheduled for May 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
